name: Gluten-Free Cheesy Ciabatta Rolls
author: The Natural Ginger
summary: A great gluten-free dinner roll that can be put together in no time. If you're going to get in to gluten-free baking, tapioca flour is going to be one of your best friends. It has great texture and weight, making a fantastic wheat substitute. In this recipe notice we don't even need a binding agent like xanthan gum? That's the beauty of using cheese!
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon sea salt, or more to taste
1 cup tapioca flour, plus more for dusting
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Whisk eggs and salt together in a large bowl with a fork
Sift tapioca flour and baking powder together over cheese mixture; mix well until cheese softens into the eggs and flour
Add enough milk to make a moist, slightly crumbly dough
Dust your work surface with tapioca flour
Scrape dough out of the bowl and knead gently until it begins to feel smooth, about 3 minutes
Shape dough into a log; divide into 4 equal pieces
Carefully roll the pieces of dough under your cupped fingers until round
Transfer to the lined baking sheet
Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden, 15 to 20 minutes
